comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: The threads I've seen listed here (at least by members I don't have on my ignore list) are more iconic than unique....though obviously a thread can be both. Â But there's already a thread about iconic threads, so I wanted to share a few bizarre/funny ones from the past. Â Maybe they're not unique, but the members who started them were either absolute ball busters or raving lunatics.Haven't seen many members in either of those categories in a while, have we?Â Â Â Â Calling out the premier scam on Havelock at the moment by MPOE-PR. Â MPOE-PR was banned by the time I registered on the forum, but I remember his/her posts from my lurking days of 2014. Â I think he's a "he" but that profile pic kind of confuses things. Â Anyway, he had a talent for writing as well as taking other members down several notches, which I consider to be a rare talent around here.Â Â Â Â Petition to have Spoetnik banned. by Fwdxlsh. Â He was a member who appeared like a thundering troll storm in 2015 and got banned (or disappeared) not long after. Â The thread above is just one of his insane ramblings, and personally I find it nostalgic that it's about Spoetnik, a member who haunted the altcoin section for a looong time and who had an ongoing--and serious--feud with Vod. Â Probably not as serious as the one Vod had with OgNasty, but I remember being astonished at how heated their arguments got. Â OK, I popped a boner, but that was years ago and I came here for the lulz, drama, and uncensored bad words. Â Runner up from Fwdxlsh is this gem: Dear BitcoinTalk: PLEASE LEAVE MRKLYE ALONE. Heh heh.And his final thread before he sailed off the flat edge of Earth: Coinman1 real thread. Erasing posts to make him look like a freaking saint! by mixan.Mixan used to be just a normal member as far as I could tell, and then something happened (and I don't remember the details and didn't look it up before posting this) and he just snapped. Â And when I say "snapped" I mean other members were concerned about his mental health and were trying to figure out what his beef was. Â He mentioned me in the OP of the thread above, but I just don't recall the details. Â Ah...I do remember that he wanted to give me his account before he signed off the forum for good, but I demurred. Â I was actively tagging anyone involved in account buying/selling/trading, and there was no way in hell I was going to take possession of his.None of the members who started the threads above or who were referenced in them are around anymore (MRKLYE for instance, who ran a porn site IIRC), but all of them added their own flavor of spice to bitcointalk. Â Not everyone liked the various flavors, but it did make for an interesting broth--much more so than we have currently.
